name: Trump SoHo New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well travelled and usually generous in my reviews, looked at the Trump and a party of 12 had a long weekend here arriving at various times over the weekend.
reviews.title: Rating is way too high...

reviews.text: Mixed responses from the group.
reviews.title: Great Views and Location

reviews.text: You can do SO much better going to New York for this money, really.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: Its bland and something of nothing really.
reviews.title: Fabulous if you need this location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its way off the centre and as much as SOHO has plenty of chic places to shop eat and drink, the Trump is offside from them.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trump SoHo really blew me away in nearly all respects. After telling the front desk upon check-in that this was a post-engagement stay, they leapt to arrange strawberries in the room and had my own bottle of champagne chilling on ice when we arrived along with rose petals on the bed. Couldn't have been nicer.
reviews.title: Amazing 1 night stay

reviews.text: The rooms are very large for NY standards and have every amenity. Everything feels new and up to date, and they really go out of the way to provide any service you could want. There's no ice machine on the floor--just call and they'll hand deliver. Forgot a hair brush? A runner will go out and purchase one for you.
reviews.title: Good value in the city-was treated GREAT by Xin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NY hotels are not cheap, but in comparison, I really have to say that you get your money's worth here. A bad experience can be had even at the most luxurious hotels--especially if they've been around for a long time. But I just can't imagine that happening here. I guess there's a reason all the reviews are glowing. They just do things right and don't cut corners.
reviews.title: Wow! Couldn't have been more satisfied!

reviews.text: Forgot my wallet at home, flight delayed until 11pm...needless to say I had a bad day-luckily I had my passport. Unfortunately I had no credit cards. Xin made sure my night didn't get worse- made sure I checked in without a problem and was able to charge a meal. Against the manager's suggestion...MR. Chasen please make sure Xin is recognized for taking the extra step to take care of a guest. I'll be back because of him.
reviews.title: Thanks Trump Soho

reviews.text: We arrived at 10:20am figuring that we would have to leave our bags with the concierge until the afternoon, but happily we were able to check in right away. We even got a complimentary upgrade to a king deluxe suite with a spectacular view of the New York skyline with the statue of liberty off in the distance. The room was exquisite! The bed was the softest I've ever experienced. The service was flawless. Couldn't have been more satisfied!
reviews.title: Trump Soho - the only place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start off with the positives, the hotel is in a great location, with lots of nice bars and shops close by. The view was spectacular and the bed was extremely comfortable. Chris the doorman was lovely, really friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very Poor service

reviews.text: The staff otherwise were not particularly friendly and we didn't receive the level of service you expect from a high end hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best in NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at 3 pm after a very long flight we wanted to get showered and changed and get on with our plans but our room wasn't ready. We said we'd go for a walk while we waited and the receptionist said she would call us when it was ready. Nearly 3 hours later we hadn't received a call and we came back to find our room still wasn't ready. When we eventually did get a room we had to wait around for our bags and eventually had to call to ask for them to be sent up. The room was nice but a little worn in places, and there was only 1 bathrobe and no water.
reviews.title: Was completely underwhelmed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second night the smoke detector in out room started beeping intermittently at 4am, as if the batteries were low. We called reception and they sent an engineer up. He changed the battery and we tried to go back asleep. 15 minutes later it started again. The engineer returned and removed the smoke detector. We had now been up for over an hour so there was no chance of us getting back asleep. At a hotel at this level you are paying to not have to put up with these kind of maintenance issues.
reviews.title: Great service but very poor hotel quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following day we returned to our room in the evening and I expected there to be a message from management addressing our interrupted sleep, but there was none. In fact, our smoke detector hadn't even been replaced, which isn't exactly safe on the 25th floor. So before we left for dinner we spoke to the receptionist, explained what had happened the night before and requested the smoke alarm be replaced.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, the finishes were high end, texture and cool mixes of materials everywhere. The suite we had was stunning. We were in a corner suite overlooking the Hudson and the Empire State Building on the 21st floor. I would have preferred a higher floor for the $ we spent but, live and learn. The bed was low and soft, divine! The bathroom, large but lacked counter space. Lighting, not so great but what hotel gets that one right!!! We were so busy exploring the city and having fun elsewhere that we didn't have a chance to eat in the restaurant until the last morning. Well, what a JOKE! We spent $54.00 dollars for thick, lumpy, gross oatmeal, with fresh fruit and mini pastries. Laughable! I would have paid it gladly for something worthwhile. Boy do they have this wrong. Take a walk across the street, past Starbucks a few blocks to Essen. There you will find a smorgasbord of breakfast treats, including an oatmeal bar. Lots of great shopping in the area. Have fun!
reviews.title: Very nice stay, but don't eat the Sunday breakfast buffet!!

reviews.text: This Hotel was recommended by New Yorker friends because of its location and larger rooms, and this was correct. We enjoyed an amazing view of the Hudson river and the Financial District in an elegant corner suite. Although the immediate area is not that attractive you can walk into Soho and Tribeca and the hotel is equidistant to Downtown and Uptown NY. There are quirky bars nearby like "Ear" and the hidden gem the Italian restaurant Giorgione a short walk down Spring Street. The only bar (the Summer Terrace Bar and Pool was obviously shut) was a small and crowded cocktail bar in the Japanese "Koi" restaurant (which looked popular).Surprised they don't do more with the "So Hi" top floor which was off limits even though it wasn't being used.There is a courtesy car that will take you on shorter trips which was great for places like the meatpacking district. Staff are pretty good and you'll get to know them through the irritatingly inefficient key-cards that seem to be a common fault in most hotels.
reviews.title: Heart of New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was everything we hoped it would be. It was our first time in New York, and we were not disappointed by anything. Posh furnishings and finishes through out the hotel, comfortable pool and bar areas. Impeccable service in every department. Fantastic food, and beautiful views. Within walking distance of upscale dining and shops. Very impressive!
reviews.title: First-rate, glamorous hotel overlooking Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a former resident of NYC and now in CA, came back for a long weekend and decided to stay at Trump Soho. I was a little nervous since I have heard negative reviews on the Trump properties but this place is amazing. From the minute we entered the hotel, the staff is great and the rooms are even better. Large bathroom, soaking tub, comfortable bed, floor to ceiling mirrors, fully stocked mini bar. They have everything you would need. Close to Soho, so you can walk over to the great shops and restaurants right around the corner. This is a great property and if you want to spoil yourself in NYC this is the spot. Forgot to the mention the pool if you are there in the summer its a great spot to relax.
reviews.title: Amazing Stay in NYC
Top of the top
reviews.text: This is the best hotel you can imagine. Very friendly staff, very clean and new hotel. Best views. We stayed at the 18th floor facing south and had amazing views. The rooms are great and big, the room service is fast and excellent. Eating pizza in your bed while seeing Manhattan skyline at night: unforgettable. Trump wine is delicious. We had a chance to go up to the top floor to see Manhattan from the top. Wow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in the city for my birthday. I called at the last minute, and was able to get one of my preferred rooms a corner suite, a "10 room" which has sweeping views of the city and rivers. The beds are comfortable, the room is large, there is even an amazing view from the tub! I especially love the doormen at this hotel, they are beyond helpful, and the hotel driver is so nice. The room service breakfast arrives in about 1/2 hour and is decent although the oatmeal is pretty horrible. Mornings are made better by the inclusion of a nesspresso machine in every room. This stay was lovely, except I do have to say the room was not as clean as it should have been, the tile was in need of a scrub in the shower. I have stayed at this Hotel 10 times. And out of those 10 I have had 2 bad stays.
reviews.title: The View and a nespresso machine

reviews.text: Star in a room with view, We looked over Hudson River and loved it. Very nice and friendly staff. Minor scratches and signs of use at furnitures.
reviews.title: Hip and Cost

reviews.text: If you like to sleep on hard surface, you need to inform the hotel beforehand. Beds are quite soft.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but lacking atmosphere & WiFi charges annoy

reviews.title: Soho Supreme

reviews.title: stay away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Trump Soho for 4 nights (Sept 29th -Oct 3rd). Definitely impressed with the property. We were upgraded to a suite (room 3207) and it was really nice. It was a true suite with separate bed room/living room. The Bathroom had a bathtub with a view. The electronics in the room were really impressive. HD TV, TV remote that also controlled the curtains and room lights. The TV remote also illuminated when it was picked up so that you could see the buttons. There was a Nespresso maker and the staff restocked the capsules every day. The shower had an incredibly nice rain shower.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.text: My only 2 complaints are that WiFi costs $15 a day and in the Café they automatically include gratuity on the bill which led to inconsistent service from the staff. Getting a refill on your coffee was like pulling teeth.
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.text: Let me tell you this hotel is TOP NOTCH! My husband and I stayed here for 10 days on our first trip to NYC. This hotel was so clean and so nice. The person at the front desk apologized for our view but we had a great view. If you look to the right we had a beautiful view of the Empore State Building. The housekeeping staff was so great. They would leave us slippers and other little surprises. The doormen were so friendly and helpful. The rest of the staff was fabulous as well. We had the time of our lives on our trip and a great part of that is because of the staff and the hotel itself at Trump Soho. One last thing, you can hear no street noise AT ALL. Great hotel!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one week in September and it really made our week in NYC fantastic. We got upgraded to a big one bed suite on the 40 th floor, with views from the living area, bedroom and bathroom - and the bathtub! - of the Hudson, downtown NYC and Jersey. Bed was really comfy, and had many a bath after a lot of walking with a glass of wine watching the view. Hotel was beautiful, very modern and clean, very stylish. Good cocktails in the bar! Fab location, there was a subway two minutes walk away and very easy to get uptown in a short space of time. Soho and surrounding areas full of great shops, bars and restaurants and within easy walking distance, away from the hustle and bustle of midtown. Spa also fab. Staff very friendly. We would return!!!!
reviews.title: Gets better every time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a regular here and I must say it get's better every time.The staff is always attentive but this time around I was greeted by a new face. The new front desk agent Tiffany was extremely courteous and professional.I've never encountered such amazing customer service.She genuinely cares about what the guest wants and I must say she is a great addition to Trump Soho.My room was amazing and I will continue to come back here.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel in SoHo

reviews.text: ..everybody shoudl experience a stay at the Trump in SoHo at least once in their lifetime. I was on business in NYC and decided to treat myself a little would either stay at the Waldorf or the Trump. Since I've never stayed at either one, I figured I'd go with the Trump, as it seems modern and it is centrally located close to many points of interest. As you enter the premises, you immediately feel the difference. The ambience is soothing, staff are highly professional and very friendly. The rooms are clean and smell very fresh. There are some modern room-control features and various amenities, that make your stay pleasant. I can only recommend it despite the pricetag.
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, Trump Soho is a good hotel. But, it's not worth all the hype. I don't have a lot of experience in New York's "five star" hotels, but this doesn't exactly feel like five stars to me. While the hotel is within walking distance of SoHo, it seems misleading to suggest that it's in SoHo (rather, it's on Varick St, a block away from the entrance to the Holland Tunnel). The lobby is interesting and tasteful, though small. Elevator lobby feels very small. The rooms are nice, though nothing special. the bathroom is dramatic, though the shower is small, the lighting around the sink is bad, and the toilet has a cheap plastic toilet set. The window shades are electric - it literally took me about 10 min to figure out how to open them. Besides a good bed and a good shower, there is one additional basic thing that I want in a hotel room - a decent coffee maker. This hotel has Nespresso machines - not sure what's wrong with me, but I can't figure out how to work these machines (and there's no directions in the room). The TV is off to the side of the room - not well positioned for watching TV while in bed. Prior to arriving in NY, I had been at the Redbury in LA. I couldn't help but keep asking, why aren't more hotels like the Redbury?
reviews.title: Good, but not worth the hype

reviews.text: Will I stay here again? Maybe. There's a lot of great hotels in NY, this won't be my first choice for the next trip.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: I chose the Trump soho to celebrate my 21st with my mum at and I wasn't disappointed! Upon arriving, we were checked in promptly, and received a complimentary upgrade to a one-bedroom corner suite on the 23rd floor. We were offered the opportunity to upgrade to the 36th floor for $89 per night, but to be honest, the views from the room were fantastic at that height anyway. From one side (and from the bath too) we had incredible views of midtown and the empire state building and from the other the hudson river. As well as this, we received a complimentary amenity of delicious chocolate covered strawberries and prosecco when we arrived! Very nice touch.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bellman took us through the controls in the room when our bags were brought up as we were having a little trouble and we soon got the hang of it. The rooms were incredibly spacious and well-appointed with a great nespresso machine and amazing beds! Honestly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Despite usually having problems sleeping, I was asleep not long after my head hit the pillow.
reviews.title: A real treat!

reviews.text: I booked to stay in a Premier Suite at the Trump SoHo for 4 nights starting the 24th August 2011. From the first moment we arrived we (my girlfriend, 5 year old son and I) were treated exceptionally well by the staff. This set the tone for a very enjoyable stay. The check in was seemless and efficient and when we walked into our 40th floor suite my breath was taken away by the views of Downtown Manhattan and the Hudson/Jersey City.
reviews.title: By far and away the best hotel I've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and furnished to a high standard, the decor was contempary and stylish. The bathroom was huge and the shower was spacious and powerful. The room (climate control, lamps and curtains) can be controlled via the TV using the remote (something my 5 year old son found quite hilarious). The bed was easily the most comfortable bed I've slept in and as someone who works away a lot, I appreciate the value of a comfortable bed! The location of the hotel is great for shopping in SoHo as well as eating out at the many varied restaurants nearby. It's also a short(ish) walk to the super childrens playground and mini golf course on Pier 25. Spring Street Metro station is less than 5 minutes from the hotel and from there it's easy to get to anywhere from Central Park to South St Seaport (nothing is more then a 25 min Metro ride).
reviews.title: Best hotel in world

reviews.text: On our 4th day Hurricane Irene hit New York. The Subway was closed from 12pm on the Saturday and we spent the best part of 36 hours in our suite. During that time it was near enough impossible to get a table at the hotel restaurant, but the management changed the room service menu and during the storm it was possible to order some of the items from the Quattro restaurant menu. The management were very communicative and all members of staff were calm and composed as the storm approached, keeping us informed of any precautions we needed to take.
reviews.title: Understated modern luxury in New York

reviews.text: As a result of the storm, it was impossible to get a return flight to the UK for 4 days (we were scheduled to fly home on Sunday and ended up flying on Thursday). Fortunately, our suite was available for the forthcoming 4 nights and the same rate was kept as the previous 3 nights. It was obviously not ideal (or budgeted for!!) but I couldn't think of a better place to stay for the additional 4 nights.
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price of food and drink was expensive, although I think this comes with the territory when staying in 5 star hotels. My son only really liked the pancakes from the breakfast menu and even then there were far too many of them for him to eat (plus they were expensive!). So in the end we took to buying cereal from the deli that is 200 yards along if you turn left out of the hotel. They also stocked other drinks and snacks that were handy to keep in the room during the hurricane.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

aka: Trump Soho New York Hotel New York City
description: Adding distinction to the skyline, Trump SoHo® New York brings a new perspective of Manhattan from its 391 guest rooms, providing unparalleled views of the city from floor-to-ceiling windows in the deluxe and premiere rooms and suites. The Spa at Trump® features New York's only luxury hammam experience, relaxation rooms and fitness center. Trump SoHo is pleased to welcome the new signature restaurant Koi SoHo, featuring an imaginative menu of contemporary Japanese cuisine. Plan your business or social gathering in one of the hotel's exclusive meeting and event spaces. Unwind over cocktails in The Library or retreat to the seasonal Bar d'Eau with its outdoor pool deck. Possessing one of the city’s most coveted locations where SoHo meets Tribeca and the West Village with celebrated art galleries, restaurants, shopping and nightlife, Trump SoHo New York is downtown like you’ve never experienced.
